intro: Gomphostemma sumatrense, commonly known as the Sumatran gomphostemma, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
